A Dependently_located_layer_connection_point is a type of that is position dependent on the location of an or an .
This part of ISO 10303 provides the capability to support one interconnect design for multiple assembly designs where components at the assembly level may or may not exist for any or all of the multiple assembly designs.
An example of an Dependently_located_layer_connection_point is the case where a common interconnect must be supplied for several assemblies. A specific microcircuit device, such as "U32" may be supplied for one or more, but not all, of the assemblies, but the interconnect must be identical.
Figure illustrates a detail of a layout drawing that shows the relationship of two members of Dependently_located_layer_connection_point and the associated .
the reference_zone specifies the role of an for the Dependently_located_layer_connection_point. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the associated_design_object specifies either the role of an or the role of an for the Dependently_located_layer_connection_point.
The associated_design_object may not fully constrain the location of the Dependently_located_layer_connection_point.

An Inter_stratum_join_implementation is one of a or a . An Inter_stratum_join_implementation is a physical feature helping to implement a . An Inter_stratum_join_implementation is not intended to be implemented alone. It is one of several Application Objects that together form the physical network implementation model.
The types of Inter_stratum_join_implementation correspond to two physical implementation mechanisms.
The first mechanism consists of creating a passage or edge in the material and then adding conductive material to the passage or edge wall and features on the to_stratum and from_stratum of the . This mechanism results in a connection between the required features implemented with the passage or edge wall.
The second mechanism does not result in a conducting passage, but relies on a bond (achieved either by direct deposition or some other means) between the features related to the specified layer_connection_points. The second mechanism usually relies on a passage in only the dielectric material separating the bonded materials. A cross-sectional view of the pcb may show a vertical displacement of strata in the area of this object, due to the fact that the dielectric is much thicker than the conductive . The shape of the vertical displacement is not a part of the definition of the Inter_stratum_join_implementation when the second mechanism is used.
the topological_requirement specifies the role of the for the Inter_stratum_join_implementation.

A Junction_vertex_allocation is the relationship that specifies one or more to which a is mapped during the layout routing process. A Junction_vertex_allocation is the result of an assignment process by a designer or a layout routing process that defines the location of or . A Junction_vertex_allocation maps a node of a Physical_network which may be only partially ordered into a network description which is highly ordered using a tree. A Junction_vertex_allocation associates two Ee_product_definitions, one an and the other a . The may be populated for the express purpose of representing the tree structure of the Physical_network in the , and therefore the version of the design would be the same for both.
the required_vertex specifies the , as a vertex of a , that is to be mapped to an implementation_point by the Junction_vertex_allocation.

the implementation_point specifies the for the Junction_vertex_allocation. The implementation_point specifies either the or that, individually, maps the requirement that a junction participates in a connectivity onto points on conducting for the Junction_vertex_allocation.
This construct allows the Junction_vertex_allocation to consider an to be a vertex.
The Junction_vertex_allocation allows for the specification of the location of the connections between physical traces and connected areas. It is common practice for the point where a trace, via, pad, etc., connects with other features to be specified by the designer interactively during layout. This location may be constrained for fabrication, layout, or signal integrity purposes. The Junction_vertex allocation specifies these relationships.
